Finitely presented semigroups and tietze transformations
In this chapter we describe the functions implemented in &Semigroups; that extend the features available in &GAP; for dealing with finitely presented semigroups.

In the later sections, written and implemented by Ben Spiers and Tom Conti-Leslie, we describe how to change the relations of a finitely presented semigroup either manually or automatically using "Semigroup Tietze" ("Stz") transformations.

Creating semigroup presentations
It is possible to use &GAP; to create finitely presented semigroups without the &Semigroups; package, by creating a free semigroup, then quotienting by a list of relations. This is described in the reference manual ().
However, finitely presented semigroups do not allow for their relations to be simplified, so in the following sections, we describe how to create and modify the "Semigroup Tietze" object associated with an fp semigroup. This object can be automatically simplified, or the user can manually apply Tietze transformations to add or remove relations or generators in the presentation.
This object is analogous to the "Tietze object" implemented for fp groups in the main &GAP; distribution (), but its features are semigroup-specific. All of the functions used to create, view and manipulate Semigroup Tietze objects are prefixed with "Stz".

Automatically simplifying a presentation
It is possible to create a presentation object from an fp semigroup object and attempt to manually reduce it by applying Tietze transformations. However, there may be many different reductions that can be applied, so StzSimplifyOnce can be used to automatically check a number of different possible reductions and apply the best one. Then, StzSimplifyPresentation repeatedly applies StzSimplifyOnce to the presentation object until it fails to reduce the presentation any further.

Automatically simplifying an fp semigroup
It may be the case that, rather than work with a presentation object, we want to start with an fp semigroup object and obtain the most simplified version of that fp semigroup that StzSimplifyPresentation can produce. In this case, SimplifyFpSemigroup can be applied to obtain a mapping from the original semigroup to a newly reduced one, and SimplifiedFpSemigroup can be used to obtain a new fp semigroup isomorphic to the first with reduced relations and generators.
